originalText.text: Working at Red Rabbit, has been an incredibly fulfilling experience. What sets this company apart is its unwavering commitment to not only providing children with the best meals but also uplifting every employee across the organization. It's heartwarming to be part of a team that genuinely cares about the well-being of both the children we serve and the people who make it all happen.

I pack her lunch bc I don‚Äôt want my baby to not eat but every day can‚Äôt be a bad day what‚Äôs going on with the staff. Who is in charge of the menus now? Who has Reese hired to make this food for his company. Hire ppl who actually care about the integrity of the food. originalText.text: Red Rabbit used to be a dependable, well-operated organization.  I'm not sure what has happened to their operations, however, this current year has been a nightmare where we are unable to reach anyone when our food is late or if we were missing food (which has happened every day this month, with the exception of 2 days).  We write emails with our concerns to the email address we were provided, and we receive no response.  The only person who helps us is the individual who was in charge of our account last year (who isn't even suppose to over see our account anymore).  She had to personally deliver the food to our program, which was 1.5 hours late, AND we were missing food.  We understand that traffic can be unpredictable and meal count can be off in the beginning of the year as we acclimate to the changes, however, when there is no response from the organization to discuss the plan they have to fix the problems that is a major red flag.  We will not be using Red Rabbit anymore unless they are able to rectify these organizational and logistical issues.

We understand that traffic can be unpredictable and meal count can be off in the beginning of the year as we acclimate to the changes, however, when there is no response from the organization to discuss the plan they have to fix the problems that is a major red flag.  We will not be using Red Rabbit anymore unless they are able to rectify these organizational and logistical issues.

originalText.text: I give it two stars because some of the meals look good like the pasta my children love it!! The problem is most of the food looks bad, of all 5 meals they maybe eat 2 and my son is not a picky eater he‚Äôll eat anything. Another problem they have is irresponsibility; they would miss meals, miss days, change dates for deliveries... and won‚Äôt even have the decency of calling you to let you know, only of it‚Äôs a snowstorm o something related to weather (to change the dates they sent an email of course)For my kids school they changed delivery days to Tuesdays!! School starts on a Monday so you know one of those meals is getting rotten or tossed away and I‚Äôm pretty sure government or somebody is paying for it, it‚Äôs a shame!!

originalText.text: My Daughter loves the Red Rabbit meals She stated it's better than the other regular school lunches and the fact that it's healthy and the kids love it makes it awesome. Too many times my daughter has complained that she had to eat Peanut butter and jelly due to nasty options provided by schools often making sandwiches the night before and I'm glad we now have an option that is similar to my healthy cooking I do at home and No, it don't  taste like plastic IT TASTE LIKE REAL FOOD which she prefers. So awesome I can relax knowing she ate just as good as she would at home THANK YOU RED RABBIT !
